titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller University records, Hospital, General Files, Series 1
A Guide to the Rockefeller University records, Hospital, General Files, Series 1 FA228

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-03-14 00:41:49 -0400.

change.item: Paper finding aid converted to EAD/XML by AureXus in 2010. Imported into the Archvistsâ€™ Toolkit by Becky Robbins.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller University records, Hospital, General Files, Series 1

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Rockefeller University records, Hospital is arranged in four series:
Series 1: General Files. Series 2: Administrative Correspondence. Series 3: Subject Files. Series 4: Collected Reprints.
Series 3 is closed to scholarly research pending further processing.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p:
Materials requiring specialized equipment for access (film, audio, video, slides) may be restricted from scholarly research dependent on availability of the applicable equipment.
Brittle or damaged items, or materials otherwise in need of preservation care, may be restricted from scholarly research at the discretion of the RAC Head of Archival Services/RAC Head of Reference.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Types of records include: printed material, memorabilia, pamphlets, and a guest book.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: On the closing of one of the hospital wards in January 1977, Miss Armstrong turned over to the archives several items of historical interest from the closed ward (in box 2).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Hospital equipment: authorized, ordered, received.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes group photos, individual portraits of Miss Alice N. Lockie, 1938; Miss Georgina M. Drew, 1938; Miss Stella R. Hoffmann, 1938.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Prepared for 1977 commencement when honorary degrees were conferred upon Alan Rushton Battersby, Michael Heidelberger, and Irvine Heinly Page. Consists of hospital staff photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Staff photographs, 1910-1981. The Rockefeller Hospital, 1982.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [2 volumes previously in Box 1 moved to Box 9, ck, 22 Oct 86.].

did.unittitle: Stadie, W.C. "The development of controlled oxygen therapy". Address delivers May 19, Chicago on presentation of Willard Gibbs medal to D.D. Van Slyke

Report of fire in the oxygen chamber (November 17, 1922) which includes signed statements from nurse, night superintendent, etc. Patient Anna Couche died. (carbon copy) Another copy in RG417 with some pictures after the fire
Binger, Carl A.L. "The construction and management of an oxygen chamber" Reprint from The Modern Hospital 24 (1925) 186-194

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Warning.
Directions for charging and operating oxygen chamber.
Precautions essential to safe operation of the oxygen chamber.

did.unittitle: Waller, Dorothy S. "Nutritive value of foods"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Eli Lilly slide rule for computing diets.

did.unittitle: Release dated 1915 October 27 signed by Edw. Denninger for taking of blood and countersigned by Harold L. Amoss

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Also signed receipt dated Oct. 23, 1915 for payment of $20.00 and release for the Hospital of all responsibility.

did.unittitle: News and Notes: articles on clinical research in The Rockefeller University Hospital: I, II, and clinical science
The Johns Hopkins Medical Journal v. 143 no. 3

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: pp. 84-103 article by A. McGehee Harvey. G. Canby Robinson: Peripatetic Medical Educator (he was the first resident in the newly opened Hospital of The Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research and this article has a section on the early days of the hospital.).

did.unittitle: 9 black notebooks labeled DIET KITCHEN, DOCTORS" ORDER BOOK
Signed orders for various food formulae
did.unitdate: September 1954-October 1955; October 1955-November 1956; November 1956-January 1958; January 1958-November 1958; 1958 November-November 1959; 1959 November-May 1961; 1961 May-October 1962; 1962 October-July 1963; 1963 July-June 1964

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: In 1977 Kathy Kleinbard became Administrator of the Hospital and sent to the archives a group of materials which were records that were kept by the hospital for many years.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sent to various hospital personnel 1938-1967 Chronologically arranged. Includes letters from Marcia Davenport quoted in G.W. Corner History of the Institute.

did.unittitle: Samuel G. Braun (Prosperity Co.) laundry system

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Floor plans, Correspondence, minutes of meetings between Institute representatives and Coolidge, Shepley, Bull-finch and Abbott and Vermilya-Brown dealing with the building of the hospital addition.

did.unittitle: Drawings and specifications for hospital addition
Covering letter with 1935 procedures outlined by
Counsel regarding furnishing of patients' records
Posting of orders and medication dispensing
Procedures of physicians affiliated with the Hospital
Signed entries of nurses time and hours
Time book for orderlies and aides

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1968/1969 budget and correspondence about salary increases 1970 Jan. 29 Magie to Drew re. salary increases.

did.unittitle: Tabulation: History and wage schedules of hospital employees

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Hospital admissions and transfers. Shows service on which patient is admitted but does not necessarily indicate condition. Includes patient days, by month, Navy census by hospital service.

did.unittitle: 2 certificates from Joint Commission on Accreditation of Hospitals
1 Patient chart - enlarged; includes colored markings
Journal, reports, receipts, and other material

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Labeled vol. 1, 2, 3, 4. Records of petty cash disbursements.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Deposited in safe and withdrawn.

did.unittitle: Receipt book of patients vol. 6 property

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cites name of patient; date of death; name of undertaker, address, tel. no., date, time, permit no. of removal of body, signature of mortician.
Examples of names found: Alma Zimbalist, Dr. Charles Stockard Alfred Smith; Dr. Homer Swift; Charles L. Hoagland.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists of arrangements for evacuation and care in the event of an emergency. Includes a route plan with New York Hospital.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with Superintendent of Hospital; Director of nurses, Dr. Horsfall, Paul Penndorf, Waldo Flinn and Dr. M. McCarty on matters of administration.

did.unittitle: Rufus Cole Lecture. Announcement of lecture by Dr. Eugene Braunwald, "Protection of the Ischemic Myocardium"

Rufus Cole Lecture, reprint of article based on the Rufus Cole lecture by Alexander G. Bearn, M.D. "The Pharmaceutical Industry and Academe: Partners in Progress" The American Journal of Medicine, Volume 71 (July 1981) 81-88
Booklet, with enclosures, "The Rockefeller University Hospital: Environment for Discovery"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Enclosures are 1-page each descriptions of laboratories: "Endocrinology" "Human Behavior and Metabolism" "Cutaneous Biology and Investigative Dermatology" "Metabolism-Pharmacology" "Bacteriology and Immunology" "Medical Biochemistry" "Lipid and Lipoprotein Metabolism"

did.unittitle: Death certifications. Board of Health, New York City
Narcotic regulations. Correspondence and printed matter

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: (See also Bernard Lupinek biographical file).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes clipping, undated, from The Edison Monthly with photo of RIMR Hospital ambulance.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Received 1 October 1984 from Carmen Schmidt via Sonya W. Mirsky with folder labeled "Mr. Lupinek".

acqinfo.p: Received 1 October 1984 from Carmen Schmidt via Sonya W. Mirsky with folder labeled "Mr. Lupinek".

acqinfo.p: Received 1 October 1984 from Carmen Schmidt via Sonya W. Mirsky with folder labeled "Mr. Lupinek".

scopecontent.p: Includes: orders and authorizations for Furniture, Kitchen equipment, Linen, Laboratory instruments, Nursing supplies, Sterilizers, Physiological apparatus, X-ray apparatus, etc.
